name: C. Row GCD
statement:
You are given two positive integer sequences a_1,
ldots, a_n and b_1,
ldots, b_m. For each j = 1,
ldots, m find the greatest common divisor of a_1 + b_j,
ldots, a_n + b_j.
editorial:
From basic properties of GCD we know that . The same applies for
multiple arguments: . Letâs use this for and subtract from all other
arguments: .If we find , then any answer can be found as . Note that we
have to assume that GCD of an empty set is , and for any , since is the
only number divisible by any other number.
